name: Pomegranate Molasses
author: flying chef
summary: Pomegranate Molasses is a syrup used in Middle Eastern cooking.  It has a bright ruby red color, and its sweet and sour flavor goes well with so many other ingredients.  It is commonly available in Middle Eastern markets, but is easily made at home if you can get pomegranate juice, now easily found in supermarkets.
directions: Bring the pomegranate juice, sugar, and lemon juice to a simmer in a saucepan over medium-high heat
Once the sugar has dissolved, reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer until the juice has reduced to 1 1/2 cups, about 1 hour
Stir the molasses frequently as it thickens to keep it from burning
When the molasses is done, allow it to cool to room temperature, then pour into a glass storage container, and keep in the refrigerator
